agreement_title: Global South Studies (Formerly Third World Studies) B.A.

general_information.text: DATED MATERIAL, SUBJECT TO CHANGE. PLEASE CONSULT CURRENT UCSD GENERAL CATALOG FOR ANY ADDITIONAL INFORMATION. Global South Studies provides an understanding of the shifting economic and political nature of the countries designated as belonging to the “Global South,” especially in light of the dramatic political and economic changes worldwide in the late 1980s and 1990s. To this end, our Global South studies courses will, where appropriate, address and contextualize the history of the term “Global South” and its current applications in scholarship and the broader international media.Global South Studies requires a minimum of twelve upper-division courses plus three lower-division courses from the Global South studies sequence (GSS 20, 21, 22, 23, 25, 26 or 27). Students interested in Global South Studies may focus on a theme, problem, or geohistorical area, such as Africa, Asia and Latin America. A Global South Studies program of study is interdisciplinary with course offerings from anthropology, economics, history, literature, political science, sociology, etc. For more information please visit globalsouth.ucsd.edu.
